dt: {bc}to exert control, direction, or influence on
{bc}to exercise control over especially by curbing or restraining
{bc}to exercise authority or power over often harshly or arbitrarily

dt.t: the speaker {it}ruled{/it} the legislature with an iron hand

dt: {bc}to mark with lines drawn along or as if along the straight edge of a {a_link|ruler}
{bc}to mark (a line) on a paper with a ruler
{bc}to be first in importance or prominence {bc}{sx|predominate||}

dt.t: the physical did not {wi}rule{/wi} in her nature

dt: {bc}to exist in a specified state or condition
used as a generalized term of praise or approval

dt.t: for a little attitude at the right price, sneakers {wi}rule{/wi}

pt: {sc}decide{/sc} {sc}determine{/sc} {sc}settle{/sc} {sc}rule{/sc} {sc}resolve{/sc} mean to come or cause to come to a conclusion. {sc}decide{/sc} implies previous consideration of a matter causing doubt, wavering, debate, or controversy.
{sc}determine{/sc} implies fixing the identity, character, scope, or direction of something.
{sc}settle{/sc} implies a decision reached by someone with power to end all dispute or uncertainty.

pt.t: the dean's decision {it}settled{/it} the campus alcohol policy

pt: {sc}rule{/sc} implies a determination by judicial or administrative authority.

pt.t: the judge {it}ruled{/it} that the evidence was inadmissible

pt: {sc}resolve{/sc} implies an expressed or clear decision or determination to do or refrain from doing something.

shortdef: to exert control, direction, or influence on
to exercise control over especially by curbing or restraining
to exercise authority or power over often harshly or arbitrarily

dt: {bc}a surface generated by a moving straight line with the result that through every point on the surface a line can be drawn lying wholly in the surface

shortdef: a surface generated by a moving straight line with the result that through every point on the surface a line can be drawn lying wholly in the surface
